marketNews.title: Kredit Tumbuh +9,7% YoY per Nov 2023, Target Tumbuh Double Digit di 2024
marketNews.content:
OJK announced the realization of banking performance as of the end of November 2023. Credit disbursement grew +0.91% month-on-month and +9.74% year-on-year to IDR 6,966 trillion, in line with the target range of +9-11%. The growth was supported by state-owned banks, which recorded a credit growth of +12.13% YoY. Third-party funds (DPK) rose to IDR 8,216 trillion (+0.21% MoM, +3.04% YoY), with deposits growing the fastest at +3.5% YoY. Net NPL ratio improved to 0.75% (Oct 2023: 0.77%, Nov 2022: 0.75%). Gross NPL ratio improved to 2.36% (Oct 2023: 2.42%, Nov 2022: 2.65%). The loan-to-deposit ratio (LDR) tightened to 84.78% (Oct 2023: 84.19%; Nov 2022: 78.78%).

The Executive Director of Banking Supervision at OJK, Dian Ediana Rae, said that credit growth in 2024 is targeted to reach double-digit, based on banks’ business plans submitted to OJK.

OJK also projects 2024 banking performance indicators as follows: Gross NPL 2-2.5%, LDR 84-86%, net profit growth +9-10% YoY.

Key Takeaway: Slower DPK growth versus credit disbursement tightens liquidity (LDR rises), creating a “price war” for DPK (cost of funds rises). This is reflected in the 11-month 2023 YoY interest-expense increase for the big-four banks: BBCA +48%, BMRI +54%, BBNI +63%, BBRI +71%.

We expect cost of funds to fall as interest-rate cuts are expected. Currently, banks with lower LDR can use their liquidity to capture market share. LDR (big-four, Nov 2023): BBCA 71%, BBRI 87%, BMRI 88%, BBNI 91%.

marketNews.title: Retail sales growth in Indonesia November 2023
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia reported that retail sales in Indonesia grew +2.1% YoY in November 2023 (Oct 2023: +2.4% YoY), marking six consecutive months of growth. Retail sales are forecast to grow +0.1% YoY in December 2023.

marketNews.title: OJK reports 85 pipeline IPOs worth IDR 28.68 trillion
marketNews.content: The Capital Market, Derivatives and Carbon Exchange Executive, Inarno Djajadi, said on Tuesday (9 Jan) that there are 85 pipeline public offerings with an indicative total value of IDR 28.68 trillion. Of these, 60 are new-issuer IPOs with a total value of IDR 10.01 trillion.

marketNews.title: Regulation on UMKM credit write-off to be finalised in H1 2024
marketNews.content: The Head of the Fiscal Policy Center, Adi Budiarso, said the regulation to write-off UMKM credit will be completed in the first half of 2024. The rule will apply to state-owned banks that have so far been unable to write-off credit, setting a defined amount for write-offs.

marketNews.title: GAPMMI targets +5-7% performance growth in 2024
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Food and Beverage Association (GAPMMI) targets a performance growth of +5-7% in 2024. Chairman Adhi S. Lukman said that assured raw-material supply makes the national food-and-beverage industry optimistic about maintaining its growth trend this year.

marketNews.title: OJK to take over crypto-related supervision from Bappebti
marketNews.content: OJK is forming a transition team to transfer authority for regulating and supervising digital assets and derivatives—including crypto—from Bappebti. Previously, Law No. 4/2023 required OJK to regulate the crypto sector no later than early 2025.

marketNews.title: AVIA buys back 7.3% of its buyback target
marketNews.content: AVIA Avian announced that it has repurchased 104.24 million shares on 9 January 2024, equal to 7.3% of the maximum buyback amount of approximately 1.43 billion (2.3%) shares. The corporate action will continue until 7 June 2025, with a funding allocation of up to IDR 1 trillion.

marketNews.title: MIDI reports 6.22% 4Q23 same-store sales growth and new store plan
marketNews.content: Midi Utama Indonesia reported same-store sales growth (SSSG) of +6.22% YoY in 4Q23 (vs. 3Q23: +3.99% YoY). In 2023, SSSG grew +6.17% YoY, beating the management target of +6% YoY. MIDI also announced plans to open 18 new Alfamidi stores in January 2024 and targets an additional 200 new stores this year.

marketNews.title: ADHI posts 58% YoY new-contract growth in 2023
marketNews.content: Adhi Karya recorded a new-contract value increase of +58% YoY to IDR 37.4 trillion in 2023, surpassing its FY23 target of IDR 27 trillion (138.5%). Engineering & construction contributed 93% of the value, manufacturing 3%, and other businesses the remainder. Funding sources were 44% from state-owned entities, 33% from the government, 14% from loans, and 9% from private parties.

marketNews.title: MORA to issue IDR 273.78 billion sukuk
marketNews.content: Mora Tele-matika Indonesia will issue sukuk worth IDR 273.78 billion, consisting of Series A of IDR 264.18 billion (10% yield, 3-year tenor) and Series B of IDR 9.6 billion (11% yield, 5-year tenor). The proceeds will be used for refinancing and investment in data-center backbone and access. The sukuk received an idA+ (sy) rating from Pefindo.

marketNews.title: CSRA to build IDR 160 billion palm-oil mill in Banyuasin
marketNews.content: Cisadane Sawit Raya’s Managing Director Gita Sapta Adi said the company will build a third palm-oil mill worth IDR 160 billion in Banyuasin, South Sumatra. The plant will sit on 2,700 ha and is targeted to produce 30 tons of fresh fruit bunches per hour. Funding comes from internal cash and bank loans, with construction expected to be completed in Q3 2025.

marketNews.title: MLPT secures IDR 162.61 billion loan from Bank Permata
marketNews.content: Multipolar Technology, through its subsidiary PT Visionet Data Internasional (VDI), signed a loan facility of IDR 162.61 billion from Bank Permata (BNLI). The facility has a 60-month tenor and will support VDI’s business activities.

marketNews.title: GSMF sells 300 million BGTG shares at IDR 83
marketNews.content: Equity Development Investment, a shareholder of Bank Ganesha, sold 300 million BGTG shares at IDR 83 per share on 8 January 2023, totaling IDR 24.9 billion. After the transaction, GSMF’s ownership in BGTG fell from 34.78% to 33.53%.

marketNews.title: Big-four banks’ interest-expense rise in 11M 2023
marketNews.content: The big-four banks’ interest-expense increase in the first 11 months of 2023 was: BBCA +48%, BMRI +54%, BBNI +63%, BBRI +71% (all compared with the same period last year).

tickerNews.content: AVIA Avian announced that it has repurchased 104.24 million shares on 9 January 2024, equal to 7.3% of the maximum buyback amount of approximately 1.43 billion (2.3%) shares. The corporate action will continue until 7 June 2025, with a funding allocation of up to IDR 1 trillion.

MIDI also plans to open 18 new Alfamidi stores in January 2024 and targets an additional 200 new stores this year.

Engineering & construction contributed 93% of the value, manufacturing 3%, and other businesses the remainder.
